item.name: 221B Baker St.: Sherlock Holmes & the Time Machine
The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game
Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
Agricola
item.comment: A great game, which strikes a solid balance between choices of strategy and opportunism. I particularly like the effort gone into balancing the setups for different numbers of players. They all seem to work for me! 2.3 kg.

Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Felix: The Cat in the Sack
A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
Le Havre
item.comment: This game just clicks for me, more so than with Agricola. In Agricola the game seems to stop just when you reach the climax. Here you get the extra time to reap the harvest of your strategy, and it feels great! 1.1 kg

Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm

Talisman (fourth edition): The Sacred Pool Expansion
Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
War of the Ring (first edition)
item.comment: A great thematic experience. With the action dice and the cards available you must create a strategy to make your side win, and it feels like a story closely related to Lord of the Rings, but with enough differences and nuances to make it interesting.

item.name: War of the Ring: Battles of the Third Age
